Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: Los Angeles County Investigates Death of Person With Monkeypox
description: Los Angeles County officials said this week that they were investigating the death of a person who had been diagnosed with monkeypox to see if the illness was a contributing cause of death.

title: Five Action Movies to Stream Now
description: This sprawling and incisive action thriller from the Indian director Anubhav Sinha offers a distinctive glimpse into the divergent political and cultural identities found in Indias northeast.

title: A Filmmaker Explores David Bowies Life and Finds Clarity About His Own
description: When the documentary filmmaker Brett Morgen hit his eighth month of writers block on an epic project about David Bowie, he decided it was time to hit the road. With just a few hours notice, he left his home in Los Angeles one morning and grabbed the first flight to Albuquerque, where Bowie had filmed The Man Who Fell to Earth (1976). When Morgen arrived, he took a cab to the train station and hopped aboard an Amtrak, heading west.

title: Trump Media Gets Aggressive With Regulators Over Delayed Merger
description: The upstart social media company backed by former President Donald J. Trump appears to be taking a more aggressive approach with regulators as it seeks approval for its delayed merger with a cash-rich shell company.

title: What will happen to the queens royal pack of corgis?
description: Among the many transitions that Queen Elizabeth IIs death has set in motion for Britain will be one that affects the smallest, and perhaps cutest, members of the royal family: the monarchs pack of four royal dogs. These include two corgis, a corgi-dachshund cross (known as a dorgi) and a cocker spaniel.

title: King Charles III is formally proclaimed to his new role.
description: Two days after the death of Queen Elizabeth II, her son Charless new role as British monarch was officially proclaimed on Saturday in a ceremony at St. Jamess Palace in London.

title: In London, Mourning, Remembrance and Tributes. And Some Shrugs.
description: LONDON  Gertrude Dudley remembers sitting on her grandfathers shoulders in 1953 at the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II, a monarch she came to know as the fabric of Britain.

title: He Stole Another Mans Name to Rejoin the Army. He Got Caught Decades Later.
description: Joel Sanders served in the United States Army from 1985 to 1988. Originally from St. Louis, Mr. Sanders was stationed in Berlin, and after being medically discharged, he stayed in Germany and made a life for himself, having six children and founding a security business.

title: Joseph Hazelwood, Captain of the Exxon Valdez, Is Dead at 75
description: Joseph Hazelwood, the captain of the tanker Exxon Valdez, which ran aground on a reef in the icy waters of Alaskas Prince William Sound in March 1989, dumping at least 10.8 million gallons of crude oil in one of Americas worst environmental disasters, has died. He was 75.

title: The Best of Late Night This Week
description: After a summer full of breaks, the late-night hosts returned just in time to talk about the documents the F.B.I. found at Mar-a-Lago. Heres what they had to say.

title: Balmoral, a Cherished Royal Getaway in Scotland, Becomes a Place of Pilgrimage
description: BALMORAL CASTLE, Scotland  By 7:30 on Wednesday morning, the flowers already lined the walls outside Balmoral Castle, the beautiful and remote Scottish country estate much loved by Queen Elizabeth II, and where her life and seven-decade reign ended on Thursday.

title: This Fish Has a Smart Shortcut
description: Hello, everyone. I missed writing to you when I was out on my summer vacation, though I didn't miss trying to come up with different ways to say delicious. (Toothsome!)

title: Wonking Out: The Mysteries of the Almighty Dollar
description: In 1971, John Connally, Richard Nixons Treasury secretary, told his counterparts from other major economies that the dollar is our currency, but its your problem. The context  the lingering demise of the Bretton Woods currency system  is ancient history. But his statement, remarkably, still rings true after all these years.

title: Mr. Mayor, Who Are You Wearing?
description: The mayor of New York City is not a labels guy.

title: Queen Elizabeth, and the Power and Limitations of Inspiring Women
description: LONDON  There is a certain story about womens progress that goes something like this: For too long, women have been held back by the personal prejudices of misguided individuals, and by societys failure to imagine their potential for dazzling achievement. But if one extraordinary woman could cut her way through, proving the doubters wrong, others would be able to follow in her footsteps. And if women can lead, equality will follow.

title: American Gigolo Review: Can You Take the Escort Out of the 80s?
description: Whatever else you thought of Paul Schraders 1980 Southern California noir, American Gigolo, you couldnt deny that it nailed its post-disco, pre-Reagan moment: the blurry, enervated style, like a music video on quaaludes; the tragic-young-man story of a high-class hooker brought low by his hubris and refusal to play by the rules; the clinical fascination with the luxury goods he used to armor himself. (And the casting of those ultimate luxury goods Richard Gere and Lauren Hutton.)

title: When Crisis Is a Constant
description: Chelsea managed to cycle through it all in nine hours, give or take. First, bright and early on Wednesday, came the announcement that the clubs owners had decided to dispense with the services of Manager Thomas Tuchel, after a reign encompassing a mere 19 months and one measly Champions League title.

title: Tina Ramirez, Founder of a Leading Hispanic Dance Troupe, Dies at 92
Hochul Declares Polio State of Emergency for New York
description: Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York declared a state of emergency on Friday over the growing polio outbreak, in an effort to better equip health care providers with tools to curb the spread of the sometimes disabling virus before it takes further hold in the state.

title: M.L.B. Bans the Shift and Adds a Pitch Clock for 2023
description: Radical defensive shifts are headed the way of flannel uniforms, train travel and organ music as Major League Baseball, a sport searching for its identity, moved Friday to institute some significant rules changes for 2023.

title: Here is the transcript of King Charles IIIs inaugural address.
description: King Charles III delivered his first address as sovereign Friday, after the death of his mother, Queen Elizabeth II. The following is a transcript of his remarks, as released by the palace.

title: Love Letter: Yes, Im Intense
description: For a long time, I focused on what the intensity of my emotions has taken from me. But my feelings also have given me the ability to imagine vivid possibilities.

title: Buy American? It Gets Complicated.
description: For all their differences, President Joe Biden resembles former President Donald Trump in one way: Both are huge believers in the Buy American cause. Just five days after his inauguration, Biden issued an executive order toughening requirements for the federal government to purchase from domestic sources where possible. A White House document said this would ensure that our future is made in all of America by all of Americas workers.

title: The U.S. Must Invest in the People Who Care for Childrens Mental Health
description: My stomach lurched when I answered the phone at my therapy practice. On the line was the latest worried and exasperated parent hoping to schedule a psychotherapy appointment with me for a child or teenager. Im one of the few child and adolescent therapists in my area, and I dreaded telling this mother that my schedule is full. I listened to her, provided a couple of referrals and suggested some self-help or online resources the family can use while they wait for a therapy opening with someone else.

title: Inside Trondheim, One of Europes Northernmost Creative Hubs
description: Welcome to T Wanderlust, a new travel newsletter from the editors of T Magazine. Twice a month, well recommend global destinations and hotels worth visiting. Sign up here to find us in your inbox every other Friday, along with our T List newsletter each Wednesday. And you can always reach us at tlist@nytimes.com.

title: B.Y.U. Says It Found No Evidence of Racial Slurs at Volleyball Match
description: Brigham Young University said Friday that it had completed its investigation into accusations of racial heckling and slurs at a volleyball match against Duke University last month and found no evidence to confirm that the behavior took place.

title: A Great Podcast, a Worthy Memoir and a Curdled Take on Clarence Thomas
description: I spent the summer away from New York City and this week am back into the swing of my real life. Already, Ive been gobsmacked by things relating to the three topics I cover here the most.

title: In New Hampshire, a MAGA Rivalry Is Splitting House Republicans
description: WASHINGTON  He calls her fake MAGA Karoline from the swamp. She calls him a Fauci foot soldier and a pharma bro.

title: In Ohio, Biden Says Democrats Have Started a Manufacturing Revival
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden attended the groundbreaking for a $20 billion computer chip factory on Friday in a heavily Republican part of Ohio, testing the power of his election-year message that Democrats have helped start a manufacturing revival with record amounts of government spending.

title: Galileo Forgerys Trail Leads to Web of Mistresses and Manuscripts
description: When the University of Michigan Library announced last month that one of its most prized possessions, a manuscript said to have been written by Galileo around 1610, was in fact a 20th-century fake, it brought renewed attention to the checkered, colorful career of the man named as the likely culprit: Tobia Nicotra, a notorious forger from Milan.

title: Credit Card Sales at Gun Stores Would Be Flagged Under New Code
description: An organization that sets standards for business transactions has voted to create a special code for gun stores to use when processing credit and debit card transactions, a move long sought by gun safety advocates who say it will help law enforcement officials spot suspicious purchases.

title: Why King Charless profile may face left on British coins, and why it matters.
description: There are 29 billion British coins in circulation with Queen Elizabeth IIs face on them. Since she first appeared on the coins, a year after her ascension in 1952, the Royal Mint has used five different portraits. And on all of them, she faces to the right.

title: Biden Administration Outlines Scope of Asian Economic Pact
description: The Biden administration on Friday concluded its first round of in-person negotiations for a proposed trade pact with more than a dozen Asian nations, the initial steps toward an agreement that officials said would reassert American influence in the Pacific and counter Chinas dominance of the region.

title: The Royal Grief You Will Not See
description: Death holds up a mirror to everything  moments of love, stretches of strife, memories that punish and exalt. This is true if your family is far removed from the public eye, and its true if your family is ensconced in the worlds spotlight.

title: Thomas Carney, Crusty Bartender at Elaines, Dies at 82
description: Thomas Carney, who served stiff drinks, hard-boiled humor and rough justice for three decades as the bartender in chief of Elaines, a saloon that furnished an improbable gathering place for New Yorks writers, actors, athletes, models, power brokers, journalists, police officers, gangsters, playboys, go-getters and countless wannabes, died on Aug. 30 at his home in Palm City, Fla. He was 82.

title: Charles, in First Speech as King, Pledges a Reign of Service to Britain
description: LONDON  Swiftly taking on the mantle of Britains monarch, King Charles III returned to London from Scotland on Friday, a day after the death of Queen Elizabeth II, to pledge that he would serve the British people with loyalty, respect and love, as I have throughout my life.

title: Queen Elizabeth II Understood the Weight of the Crown
description: She died in her happy place. It was a photograph of herself and Prince Philip at Balmoral, wrapped in a tartan picnic blanket beside the hills of her beloved Loch Muick, that she chose to release on the eve of his funeral last year. Balmoral is where it is said he proposed to her and where, throughout her life, she spent contented summer months unassailed, except by her own family.

title: Ukraine Claims Major Gains in Kharkiv
description: Welcome to the Russia-Ukraine War Briefing, your guide to the latest news and analysis about the conflict.

title: Burbank Review: When Disneys Animators Went on Strike
description: On the lawn outside Walt Disneys snazzy new animation studio in Burbank, Calif., a young woman is out cold. The apple that was going to be her meager lunch has slipped from her grasp and rolled away.

title: Russia Holds First Elections Since Ukraine Invasion, but Opposition Is Mostly Absent
description: MOSCOW  Russians began voting on Friday in the first nationwide elections since the invasion of Ukraine in a climate of wartime censorship and repression, with the Kremlin trying to assure the public that it was business as usual.

title: People Are Weight Training Barefoot. Is There Any Upside?
description: About two years ago, Claire Haeuptle, a physical therapist based in San Diego, was interested in strengthening the muscles and ligaments of her feet. Dr. Haeuptle, who played four years of collegiate basketball, has a history of knee injuries, including five surgeries.

title: William and Catherine are now Prince and Princess of Wales.
description: The titles King Charles III granted Friday upon his oldest son, William, and Williams wife, Catherine, bridged two distinct eras of the royal family.

title: Ukraine Attacks Russia Along Northern Front, Swiftly Making Gains
description: KYIV, Ukraine  Ukrainian forces have scored the most significant battlefield gains since they routed Russia from the area around Kyiv in April by reclaiming territory in the northeast, according to Ukrainian officials, Western analysts and battlefield imagery.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Lars Vogt, Acclaimed Pianist and Conductor, Is Dead at 51
description: Lars Vogt, a sensitive, communicative pianist whose warmth as a collaborator made him an outstanding chamber musician and a conductor of growing stature, died on Monday at a clinic in Erlangen, Germany. He was 51.

title: Sheila Tobias, Who Defined Math Anxiety, Dies at 86
description: When Sheila Tobias finished her freshman year at Radcliffe College in 1954, her professor in a natural sciences course congratulated her on her performance. But for many years she was troubled that he had not encouraged her to take more science classes. When she finally asked him, he said that her limited science background had already made her ineligible for a science career.

title: The American Guided Rockets Helping Ukraine Destroy Russian Forces
description: Out of the billions of dollars in weapons the White House has shipped to Ukraine since the Russian invasion, perhaps none have attracted as much attention as the M142 HIMARS, an advanced rocket launcher that Ukrainian troops have used to devastating effect.

title: Navy Orders High-Level Outside Investigation of SEAL Course
description: The Navy has started an independent investigation of the brutal selection course for its elite SEALs after a sailors death this year revealed a tangle of physical abuse, poor medical oversight and use of performance-enhancing drugs in the course.

title: Marc Lewitinn, Covid Patient, Dies at 76 After 850 Days on a Ventilator
description: As the Covid-19 pandemic swept across the country in March 2020, the family of Marc Lewitinn, their 74-year-old patriarch, urged him to stay indoors. He had survived lung cancer and a stroke that left him unable to speak, and doctors were already warning that older people with his sort of medical history were especially vulnerable to the virus.

title: First Kansas, Next Michigan and Beyond as Abortion Ballot Measures Spread
description: The inclusion of an abortion-rights referendum on Michigans November ballot has given Democrats hope for a wave of enthusiastic voter turnout on Election Day as the movement to allow voters to decide the issue directly sweeps outward from the first state that did so, Kansas.

title: Two Top Trump Political Aides Among Those Subpoenaed in Jan. 6 Case
description: The Justice Department has subpoenaed two former top White House political advisers under President Donald J. Trump as part of a widening investigation related to Mr. Trumps post-election fund-raising and plans for so-called fake electors, according to people briefed on the matter.

title: Mentors Named for Next Class in Rolex Arts Initiative
description: The Ghanaian-born visual artist El Anatsui, the British writer Bernardine Evaristo, the Chinese filmmaker Jia Zhangke, the French architect Anne Lacaton and the American jazz singer Dianne Reeves are the new mentors in the Rolex Mentor and Protg Arts Initiative, a program started by Rolex in 2002 to foster new generations of outstanding talent.

title: Californians Unsure if Tropical Storm Will Be Friend or Foe
description: LOS ANGELES  After a week of record-shattering heat and explosive wildfires, weary Californians were buffeted on Friday by Tropical Storm Kay, which delivered both the possibility of destruction and the promise of sweet relief.

title: M.L.B. Will Voluntarily Recognize Minor League Union
description: Major League Baseball will voluntarily recognize the M.L.B. Players Association as the formal union representative of minor league players, Commissioner Rob Manfred said on Friday. At a news conference regarding upcoming on-field rules changes in the major leagues, Manfred announced the notable development in the rapidly progressing unionization efforts by minor league players.

title: Yeshiva University Can Bar L.G.B.T. Club for Now, Justice Rules
description: Justice Sonia Sotomayor said on Friday that Yeshiva University in Manhattan can for now disregard a state court ruling that ordered it to recognize an L.G.B.T. student club  a case she said could be considered by the full Supreme Court.

title: To Play an Anti-Gay Parent, Gabrielle Union Dug Deep for The Inspection
description: After nearly 30 years of working in Hollywood, Gabrielle Union is used to facing slings and arrows. Still, when she opens up Twitter and sees people attacking her trans daughter, Zaya Wade, it hits differently.

title: Writers Block?
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Something neat about this solve today: If you felt at all cocky about getting through a Saturday grid from Kameron Austin Collins without feeling as if you just scaled the worlds third- or fourth-tallest mountain, that might be because this construction has been laid on its side: Its Across entries are distinctly shorter and more doable than its downs.

title: Justice Dept. and Trump Legal Team Clash Over Special Master Candidates
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department and lawyers for former President Donald J. Trump failed to agree on Friday on who could serve as an independent arbiter to sift through documents the F.B.I. seized from Mr. Trumps Florida club and residence last month.

title: What makes Casper Ruud a worthy opponent in the final.
description: In the mens final of the U.S. Open, Casper Ruud will put up a fight.

title: Carlos Alcaraz Outlasts Frances Tiafoe to Reach the U.S. Open Final
description: Nearly every year now, it seems, the U.S. Open becomes a life-changing event.

title: Corrections: Sept. 10, 2022
description: An article on Friday about King Charles IIIs elevation to the throne upon the death of Queen Elizabeth II misstated the age of Camilla, the queen consort. She is 75, not 74.

title: Quotation of the Day: Heating Aid For the Poor Will Be Less
description: I pray  a lot. Because some things and situations are just beyond your control.

title: Ons Jabeur and Iga Swiatek Face Mental Test in U.S. Open Final
description: Listening to the two womens finalists in the U.S. Open, it can be easy to forget that tennis is a sport that involves strength, speed, athletic skill and some strategy.

title: W.N.B.A. Finals Preview: The Aces and Sun Fight for Their First Title
description: Twenty-three years ago, Becky Hammon and Curt Miller helped lead Colorado State to the round of 16 in the N.C.A.A. Division 1 womens basketball tournament. Miller was an assistant coach, and Hammon was one of the best players in the country. On Sunday, theyll match up in the W.N.B.A. finals as opposing coaches, hoping to win their first titles as Hammons Las Vegas Aces take on Millers Connecticut Sun.

title: For Ukraine, the Fight Is Often a Game of Bridges
description: KHERSON REGION, Ukraine  The pontoon bridge had been in place for barely a day. The Ukrainian Army rushed to move troops and equipment across. Then the soldiers watched on a drone video feed as the Russians blew up their bridge, yet again.

title: For Florida A&M, Getting on the Field Is Just One of Many Problems
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla.  Heres what comes with being a football player at Florida A&M: getting booted from the dorms during training camp and sleeping in your car. Bad or uncertain advice from an overwhelmed staff about what classes to sign up for. Monthslong waits for the scholarship check that covers your meals and rent.

title: How a Marathon Win 50 Years Ago Kick-Started the Running Boom
description: For people who favor clean and simple marks for the start of something new, Americas running boom began 50 years ago today, on Sept. 10, 1972, when Frank Shorter, a Yale graduate and law student at the University of Florida, won the marathon at the Munich Olympics.

title: Mosquito Fire near Sacramento is at a tipping point, fire officials say.
description: PLACERVILLE, Calif.  The Mosquito fire, a 30,000-acre blaze raging through the Sierra Nevada foothills northeast of Sacramento, has calmed slightly Friday after explosive growth a day earlier, fire officials said.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: SATURDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Clover Lawns Are Blooming in Front Yards, and on TikTok
description: Edwina von Gal thinks that grass lawns can become like cigarettes: something that was once in vogue and backed by a massive industry that can be rebranded as an unhealthy and costly symbol of American corporatism.

title: Looking for More Frances Tiafoes
description: It is impossible to quantify how many young Black girls have signed up for tennis lessons since the late 1990s when Serena and Venus Williams burst onto the scene under the guidance of their father, Richard Williams, or how many parents of athletic Black girls living in America, tried to follow his blueprint and repeat the Williamss success.

title: Guaranteed Income Programs Spread, City by City
description: Early in the pandemic, Alondra Barajas had a temporary job for the Census Bureau, doing phone work from the two-bedroom apartment she shared with her mother and four younger siblings. When that job ended in late 2020, she struggled to find employment.

title: These maps show how Ukraine is rapidly advancing around Izium.
description: Ukraines military made significant advances in recent days near the northeastern city of Izium, a key Russian stronghold, according to military analysts and geolocated photos and videos. The breakthrough  possibly some 50 kilometers in just a few days  threatened to encircle Russian forces, which appeared to be caught by surprise.

title: Do No Harm: OB-GYNs Weigh the Legal Impact of Abortion Bans
description: As anti-abortion laws take effect across the country, doctors treating patients with high-risk pregnancies are facing difficult decisions  and legal risks  over their standards of care.

title: How Do I Make My Landlord Improve Fire Safety?
description: Q: I am concerned about evacuation safety in my 14-story Midtown rental building. The building has two passenger elevators and one service elevator. Recently, staff began locking the service elevator at night, leaving two working elevators for about 150 apartments. I worry that we well need all the elevators in an emergency evacuation, because the stairwells are not a reliable alternative for older residents  theyre often dark because the light bulbs burn out, and the treads are narrow and slippery from high-gloss paint. Does management have a responsibility to keep our means of egress safe and navigable, and to keep all our elevators working regularly?

title: A Global History of Gender, in All Its Varieties
description: In Before We Were Trans, the nonbinary British academic Kit Heyam undertakes an inherently impossible task: to encompass the story of a planet in a single book. But this impossibility proves the value of the effort: As they demonstrate in this astute, self-aware and riveting study, the history of gender nonconformity around the world is so vast that no book can begin to contain its reaches.

title: The Broncos Will Be Good Because Russell Wilson Said So
description: ENGLEWOOD, Colo.  Russell Wilson does not believe in balance. That word suggests that he in any way conserves energy, parceling it out among football and family, his fans and his business ventures, instead of investing every neuron of his being into whatever he is doing in the moment.

title: 6 Y.A. Love Stories to Add to Your Reading List
description: My favorite love stories are philosophical talkies. The ones where the characters are witty, opinionated and deeply curious about the world around them. These characters dont so much fall in love but rather open themselves to love and to the possibility that the world is wilder, bigger and different than theyd previously known.

title: How the CUNY Chancellor Spends His Sundays
description: Flix Matos Rodrguez oversees the largest urban public university system in the United States.

title: Medical Impact of Roe Reversal Goes Well Beyond Abortion Clinics, Doctors Say
description: In Wisconsin, a group of doctors and lawyers is trying to come up with guidelines on how to comply with a newly revived 173-year-old law that prohibits abortion except to save the life of a pregnant woman. They face the daunting task of defining all the emergencies and conditions that might result in a pregnant womans death, and the fact that doctors could be punished with six years in prison if a prosecutor disagrees that abortion was necessary.

title: The Olive Oil Capital of the World, Parched
description: The branch, plucked from one of thousands of trees in this densely packed olive grove, has browning leaves and a few tiny, desiccated buds that are bunched near the end. To Agustn Bautista, the branch tells a story and the story is about a harvest that is doomed.

title: With Tears and Steel, Kenyas Hustler President Vanquishes His Foes
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  William Ruto wept when he won, falling to his knees in prayer after Kenyas Supreme Court confirmed his presidential win last week, the climax of a bruising courtroom battle over the results of a hard-fought election.

title: The Wedding Photographer Favored by High Society and Fashion Royalty
description: German Larkin had never photographed a wedding when he booked his first job, at the Palace of Versailles in May 2017.

title: Jann Wenner Wants to Reveal It All
description: MONTAUK, N.Y.  Rock may be dead, but Jann Wenner is still rolling.

title: A Proud Nuclear Town Grapples With How to Remember the Bomb
description: RICHLAND, Wash.  In the arid shrublands of southeastern Washington state, a small agricultural outpost underwent a covert transformation during World War II. Thousands of workers converged next to the Columbia River, rushing to produce the material needed for the ultimate weapon.

title: In an ancient ceremony with a modern twist, King Charles III is formally proclaimed sovereign.
description: LONDON  For more than 300 years, Britains kings and queens have been proclaimed sovereign in a ceremony laced with history. But on Saturday morning, for the first time, the public was able to see the process in action as the proclamation of King Charles III was broadcast live, weaving just a bit of modernity into a centuries-old tradition.

title: Hong Kong Sentences 5 to 19 Months for Childrens Books Deemed Seditious
description: SEOUL  Five speech therapists in Hong Kong were sentenced to 19 months in prison on Saturday after they published a series of childrens books that the court said instilled a hatred of the government in young readers.

title: A Time of Horror in a Place of Family and Beauty
description: Only 48 hours or so had passed since two brothers had gone on a stabbing rampage, mostly on the James Smith Cree Nation in Saskatchewan, that had left 10 people dead and 18 injured and resulted in the end of both mens lives. But when Amber Bracken, a photographer from Edmonton on assignment for The Times, and I pulled into a horse ranch on the reserve for an arranged meeting with Ivor Wayne Burns and his family, one of the brothers was still alive  and we were met with unexpected chaos.

title: Read King Charles IIIs declaration to the Accession Council.
description: After he was officially proclaimed Britains new sovereign on Saturday, King Charles III delivered a declaration to the Accession Council.

title: TVs Prequel-Mania
description: The past is with us all, whether we like it or not. So says Arondir (Ismael Cruz Crdova), an elf soldier in Amazon Prime Videos The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power.

title: What John Donne Knew About Death Can Teach Us a Lot About Life
description: The power of John Donnes words nearly killed a man.

title: Strong Women, Madwomen, Mob Women
description: Dear readers,

title: Redefining What Nerd Culture Looks Like
description: This article is also a weekly newsletter. Sign up for Race/Related here.

title: Wall Streets Favorite Sport Is a Failing Business
description: The DealBook newsletter delves into a single topic or theme every weekend, providing reporting and analysis that offers a better understanding of an important issue in business. If you dont already receive the daily newsletter, sign up here.

title: After Decades of Silence, Art About Abortion (Cautiously) Enters the Establishment
description: In recent years, a fashion for painting the human figure has preoccupied the art world, with an emphasis on race, gender and other urgent social issues. Yet another pressing topic in America has been curiously absent from art: abortion, which became all the more timely when the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade in June.

title: Jennifer Egan and the Goon Squad
description: For the next few months, were sharing some of our favorite conversations from the podcasts archives. This weeks segments first appeared in 2010 and 2020, respectively.

title: Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic
description: This is Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic, a weekly review of the game that drives me out of my hivemind. In a good way. Sometimes.

title: Charles in Charge
description: WASHINGTON  His whole life, King Charles has been in the shadow of women with more star power.

title: Glorious Hero or Deplorable Traitor? Ptains Legacy Haunts French Island
description: LE DYEU, France  On a recent afternoon, three French friends, still groggy from a long night of partying on a tiny island south of Brittany, stopped by a cemetery to snap a photograph of a grave they had heard so much about.

title: Gun Violence Epidemic Looms Large Over a Swedish Election
description: STOCKHOLM  The best years were still ahead for Susanna Yakes and her 12-year-old daughter, Adriana. The two danced to music around the house and screamed together on roller coasters  still ahead were more adult milestones like travel and love.

title: For Trumps Lawyers, Legal Exposure Comes With the Job
description: A dark joke has begun circulating among lawyers following the many legal travails of former President Donald J. Trump: MAGA actually stands for making attorneys get attorneys.

title: Mourners leave sunflowers outside Windsor Castle in tribute to the queen.
description: WINDSOR, England  Thousands of people paid their respects to Queen Elizabeth II outside Windsor Castle on Saturday, placing bouquets of flowers, many of them sunflowers, at the gates to the castle where the queen had spent much of her time.

title: Marsha Hunt, Actress Turned Activist, Is Dead at 104
description: Marsha Hunt, who appeared in more than 50 movies between 1935 and 1949 and seemed well on her way to stardom until her career was damaged by the Hollywood blacklist, and who, for the rest of her career, was as much an activist as she was an actress, died on Wednesday at her home in Los Angeles. She was 104.

title: Queens Death Leaves U.K. Grappling With Its Sense of National Identity
description: LONDON  No sooner had the long-anticipated news broken  Queen Elizabeth II was dead  than Britain activated Operation London Bridge, the painstakingly choreographed funeral plan that guides the country through the rituals of tribute and mourning that culminate with her burial 10 days later.

title: Want to Regain Parents Trust, Public Health Institutions? Be Humble.
description: This week, my colleague Dana Goldstein reported that Head Start preschools and child care centers are still requiring teachers and children as young as 2 to wear masks. As she explains, this is out of sync with the latest guidelines from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The vast majority of schools and day care centers have made masks optional, even in the most virus-cautious regions of the country, Goldstein writes.

title: Censorship Is the Refuge of the Weak
description: Fights about free speech can feel rhetorical until they are not. Heres what censorship looks like in practice: A student newspaper and journalism program in Nebraska shuttered for writing about pride month. The state of Oklahoma seeking to revoke the teaching certificate of an English teacher who shared a QR code that directed students to the Brooklyn Public Librarys online collection of banned books. A newly elected district attorney in Tennessee musing openly about jailing teachers and librarians.

title: Rudy Giuliani Is Alone
description: It has been 21 years since Rudy Giuliani led a terrified city through the deadliest attack in its history. As a reporter covering him from a few feet away that morning, I ran with him from the hurricane of ash and debris following the collapse of the World Trade Centers North Tower, trekked a mile up a Manhattan avenue as he and his aides searched for safe harbor and watched his security detail break into a firehouse with a crowbar.

title: Linda Evangelista, the It Bag and Sex and the City
description: New York Fashion Week began in earnest with a time-space collapse Friday night at the Hammerstein Ballroom in midtown Manhattan.

title: Democrats Didnt Conjure Up the Demand for MAGA Candidates
description: In my column this week, I tackled some of the major objections to President Bidens Philadelphia speech on MAGA Republicans and the threat they pose to democracy, including the view that it was too divisive.

title: Teenagers Are in Distress. Which Treatments Are Best?
description: To the Editor:

title: Queen Elizabeths funeral will be held on Sept. 19 at Westminster Abbey.
description: LONDON  The state funeral for Queen Elizabeth II will be held at 11 a.m. Monday, Sept. 19, at Westminster Abbey, Buckingham Palace announced on Saturday. The queen, who died on Thursday at Balmoral Castle, her summer retreat in the Scottish Highlands, now lies in the castles ballroom, her oak coffin draped in the royal standard of Scotland, officials said in a briefing about the funeral arrangements.

title: Does Casper Ruud Stand a Chance Against the Tireless Carlos Alcaraz?
description: It was nearly 2 a.m. at the U.S. Open (of course it was), and Carlos Alcaraz was cheerfully giving a news conference after his latest five-set thriller.

title: The Jokes on Fashion Week
description: Is it appropriate to tell a joke about body fluids while wearing Chanel?

title: How Ukraine Gained Momentum Against Russia and Took a Critical Hub
description: KYIV, Ukraine  In a war that has for months been defined by grinding battles between two armies along largely static front lines ranging 1,500 miles, the stunning speed of Ukraines advance in the countrys northeast has reshaped the conflict in a matter of days.

title: Billy McFarland Is Out of Jail and Ready for His Next Move
description: Is this technically Dumbo? Billy McFarland asked, walking toward the East River shoreline. Its super cool. Are the rents here crazy too?

title: King Charles III Is Formally Proclaimed to His New Role
description: LONDON  While Prince Charles became Britains new king automatically on the death of his mother, Queen Elizabeth II, on Thursday, his role was officially proclaimed on Saturday morning in a ceremony laden with pomp and procedure at St. Jamess Palace, a Tudor royal residence near Buckingham Palace.

title: The Ukraine Wars Decisive Season
description: The summer of war in Ukraine, while brutal for soldiers and civilians on the front lines, has been experienced from afar as a stalemate, depressing enough in its grinding sameness to slip out of American headlines for a time.

title: As Russians Retreat, Putin Is Criticized by Hawks Who Trumpeted His War
description: As Russian forces hastily retreated in northeastern Ukraine on Saturday in one of their most embarrassing setbacks of the war, President Vladimir V. Putin was at a park in Moscow, presiding over the grand opening of a Ferris wheel.

title: Cooler, Wetter Weather Brings California a Moment of Relief
description: LOS ANGELES  For more than a week, Californians endured a heat wave that smashed records, pushed the states energy grid to the brink and parched the landscape, creating conditions ripe for catastrophic wildfires. Several new blazes ignited and quickly burned through bone-dry vegetation, sending thousands fleeing from their homes.

title: All the Beauty and the Bloodshed Wins Best Film at Venice Film Festival
description: All the Beauty and the Bloodshed, directed by Laura Poitras, was awarded the Golden Lion for best film at the 79th Venice International Film Festival on Saturday by a competition jury led by Julianne Moore. The film, about the photographer Nan Goldin, was the rare documentary to win the Golden Lion and won over strong competitors.

title: After an Arsenic Scare, City Says a Housing Complexs Water Is Safe
description: Residents at a public housing complex in Manhattan spent a week without tap water following a report that it had elevated levels of arsenic. But on Saturday, New York City officials said that new tests confirmed that the water at the development had never been dangerous.

title: Mosquito Fire Rages in Northern California
description: Firefighters said conditions had improved, and there was an opportunity to control the blaze after it had quickly spread through the Sierra Nevada foothills northeast of Sacramento.

title: Sons of King Charles III Make Rare Joint Appearance Outside Windsor Castle
description: The sons of King Charles III and their wives made a rare joint appearance on Saturday outside Windsor Castle, greeting crowds that had gathered to leave flowers and messages remembering Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Mable John, Soul Singer With a Star-Studded Rsum, Dies at 91
description: Beyond her many other accomplishments  collaborating on a hit single with Isaac Hayes, singing backup for Ray Charles  Mable John earned a place in the music pantheon as one of the first female artists signed to the Motown Records empire, which altered the face of pop music in the 1960s.

title: Harvest Moon Lights Up Skies and Marks Start of Festivals Worldwide
description: If youre someone who rejoices at every sign of fall, you may want to look out at the moon this weekend.

title: James Stewart Polshek, Quiet Giant of Modern Architecture, Dies at 92
description: James Stewart Polshek, who over a nearly 70-year career designed some of the countrys most significant works of public architecture even as he resisted the profitable allure of trendy ideologies and design celebrity, died on Friday at his home in Manhattan. He was 92.

title: Opposites Attract
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Derrick Niederman lives in Charleston, S.C., and is a former teacher of mathematics at the College of Charleston. He is working on a statistics textbook that incorporates puzzles. He is also one of The New York Timess longest-standing crossword contributors and a true specialist of the big grid; this is his 13th construction since 1983, and all of them have come on a Sunday.

title: Iga Swiatek Downs Ons Jabeur to Win U.S. Open Womens Singles Title
description: The 2022 U.S. Open will always be remembered  outside of Poland, at least  for its farewell to Serena Williams, long the queen of tennis and the greatest womens player ever.

title: Ukrainian Offensive Seen as Reshaping the Wars Contours
description: KYIV, Ukraine  A lightning Ukrainian offensive in the countrys northeast has reshaped what had become a grinding war of attrition. In a matter of days, Russian front lines have buckled, Moscows troops have fled and one village after another has come once more beneath Ukraines yellow and blue banner.

title: Ukrainian Officials Drew on U.S. Intelligence to Plan Counteroffensive
description: WASHINGTON  Senior Ukrainian officials stepped up intelligence sharing with their American counterparts over the summer as they began to plan the counteroffensive that allowed them to make dramatic gains in the northeast in recent days, a shift that allowed the United States to provide better and more relevant information about Russian weaknesses, according to American officials.

title: Iga Swiatek, U.S. Open Winner, Is Ready for Global Stardom
description: Upon arrival in New York for this years U.S. Open, I was delighted to return to a city that is on its way back, as ever, after hard times. But I was surprised to keep hearing questions about womens tenniss lack of a dominant player.

title: Chinese Drones: The Latest Irritant Buzzing Taiwans Defenses
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  At first the Taiwanese soldiers ignored the drones flying from China. Then, as the flights increased, they fired warning shots. Finally, the soldiers shot one into the sea.

title: Very Dire: Devastated by Floods, Pakistan Faces Looming Food Crisis
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Violent swells have swept away roads, homes, schools and hospitals across much of Pakistan. Millions of people have been driven from their homes, struggling through waist-deep, fetid water to reach islands of safety. Nearly all of the countrys crops along with thousands of livestock and stores of wheat and fertilizer have been damaged  prompting warnings of a looming food crisis.

title: Corrections: Sept. 11, 2022
description: An article this weekend on Page 28 about theater events this season, using information from a publicist, misidentifies Michael Shannon as a member of the cast of the play Evanston Salt Costs Climbing. He will not be in the play.

title: Quotation of the Day: 2 Bright Young Stars Each Need to Win 3 Sets to Reach No. 1
description: Sometimes you have to come up with a little magic, you know?

title: Just Bread and Noodles: Chinas Covid Lockdown Distress Hits Xinjiang
description: This summer, Yining, a city in the Xinjiang region of far-western China, celebrated a boom of Chinese tourists seeking a sunny respite from Covid worries in their hometowns. Now Yining is under its own grueling, weekslong pandemic lockdown, with residents calling for help over limited food, difficulty getting medicines and drastic shortages of sanitary pads for women.

title: Russia says that a senior Chinese official expressed support for the invasion of Ukraine.
description: A senior Chinese official offered Beijings most robust endorsement yet of Moscows war in Ukraine, telling a group of Russian lawmakers on Friday that China understands and supports Russia, particularly on the situation in Ukraine, according to an official Russian description of the meeting.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: SUNDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Share Your Stories About Hasidic Schools
description: A New York Times investigation found that scores of Hasidic Jewish schools in New York state are purposely denying students a basic secular education  and have received $1 billion in public money over the last four years.  The schools appear to be operating in violation of state education law. Many also use corporal punishment to keep children in line, The Times found.

title: The Big, Wide World of Narrow Beats
description: Kenneth Chang, a Science writer who reports on outer space, says he has the wonder beat. The future of work reporter Emma Goldberg writes about, as a teammate once said, business vibes. Talya Minsberg, who covers extreme sports and adventurous feats, says her stories usually fall under the umbrella of things that could maybe kill you.

title: A Slain Reporter, a City of Sin and a Politician Charged With Murder
description: LAS VEGAS  As one of four reporters on the investigative team of Las Vegass main newspaper, Jeff German wrote stories that reached nearly every sordid corner of Sin City.

title: In Hasidic Enclaves, Failing Private Schools Flush With Public Money
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: For Jann Wenner, the Music Never Stopped
description: Jann Wenners new memoir, Like a Rolling Stone, is the literary equivalent of a diss track: a retort to Joe Hagans biography, Sticky Fingers, which was published five years ago, after Wenners initial cooperation curdled into public repudiation. This it accomplishes with that ultimate diss, the silent treatment  acting like Hagans book never existed.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $650,000
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: How Student Debt Killed the Plot
description: In Emily St. John Mandels novel The Glass Hotel (2020), a young woman named Vincent is trying to understand how she went from being a bartender at a remote inn in the Canadian wilderness to preparing to leave for Nice on the arm of a Ponzi-scheme billionaire named Jonathan Alkaitis. After all, shouldnt she be in school?

title: So You Wanted to Get Work Done at the Office?
description: Marjorie Roberts, who runs a nonprofit in the Florida Keys, started out a recent morning with a list of tasks that ideally she would have raced right through. Figure out coverage for someone going on summer vacation. (Easy.) Look at the accountants recent audit. (Blah.) Redo a reimbursement request that the county finance department turned down. (Why?!) All simple enough.

title: All Biden Has to Do Now Is Change the Way We Live
description: When the summer began, the Biden administration was mired in failure. Inflation was high, the Build Back Better agenda was dead, the Democrats were doomed. Then came the fastest turnabout Ive seen in American politics. In short order, the CHIPS Act and the Inflation Reduction Act passed; Biden canceled billions in student debt; gasoline prices dropped; employment kept booming; Democrats began outperforming in special elections. All hail Dark Brandon.

title: Feds Exit Puts Worlds Biggest Bond Market on Shakier Ground
description: Traders are worried about the worlds largest and most important government bond market, as the Federal Reserve quickens the pace at which it removes one of its primary pandemic supports.

title: Rise in Deaths Spurs Effort to Raise Alcohol Taxes
description: Oregon is a drinkers paradise. The state boasts more craft distilleries than Kentucky and is second only to California in the number of wineries. Some call Portland beervana for its bevy of breweries.

title: School Is Back
description: Fashion week got an early start, or at least the partying did. On Wednesday, the Couture Council of the Museum at FIT honored Maria Grazia Chiuri, the creative director of Dior, at its annual luncheon. Designers, fashion editors, buyers and other aesthetes attended the gathering at Lincoln Center, many in their best Dior.

title: Crowds lined the route from Balmoral to bid farewell to their queen.
description: EDINBURGH  The coffin carrying Queen Elizabeth II on her final journey on Sunday arrived in the Scottish capital Edinburgh  now the focus of national mourning  after a six-hour procession from Balmoral Castle, the country estate where she died.

title: Ukraine begins to shut down the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant as a safety measure.
description: Ukraine on Sunday began turning off the last working reactor at the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant, after concluding that keeping it running could well be the prelude to a nuclear meltdown at Europes largest nuclear power facility.

title: My Family Fought the British Empire. I Reject Its Myths.
description: On my desk I have a scuffed silver coin that I had to rummage through a box to find. It was given to me in 1977  there was one for every child in my British primary school  to commemorate the Silver Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II. I was 7 and she had already been on the throne for 25 years.

title: The Sunday Read: How the Claremont Institute Became a Nerve Center of the American Right
description: The Claremont Institute, a right-wing think tank in California, has in recent years become increasingly influential in Republican circles. In 2016, its goal was to turn Donald J. Trump into a legitimate candidate  and then it did.

title: Chiles Constitutional Moment Is Not Over
description: Chilean voters broke turnout records when they elected Gabriel Boric, a former student leader, as Chiles youngest president in December. And last Sunday, just six months into his presidency, they broke a record again, resoundingly rejecting a project Mr. Boric championed from the start: a new, progressive Constitution designed to bury the one Chile inherited from Augusto Pinochet.

title: How to Argue Well
description: Schools in session. Workers have been summoned back. Campuses are open for protests and counterprotests, invitations and disinvitations. And a nasty round of midterms is upon us.

title: I Asked the Cabby to Pull Over at the Next Open Bodega We Passed
description: Dear Diary:

title: Britains Mourning Rituals
description: Britain has entered a mourning of Queen Elizabeth II that incorporates a pomp that few people alive have seen, given the length of her reign. Churches tolled their bells, and dozens of gun salutes were fired. The top English soccer league postponed its weekend matches, and most programming on television was about her. Her funeral, scheduled for Sept. 19, will be a national day off.

title: As Ukraine advances, a reticent Germany faces more pressure to help.
description: Ukrainian forces swift advance in the northeast has increased the pressure on Germany, Europes largest economy, to move faster with the delivery of heavy weapons.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | Sept. 12, 2022
description: 1. After looking closely at the image above (or at the full-size image), think about these three questions:

title: Diane Noomin, 75, Is Dead; Gave Underground Comics a Feminist Voice
description: Diane Noomin, who was a pioneer of feminist underground comics in the 1970s and whose comic book Twisted Sisters, a collaboration with her fellow artist Aline Kominsky-Crumb, has been a touchstone for generations of female cartoonists, died on Sept. 1 at her home in Hadlyme, Conn. She was 75.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. Its that awful day again, filled with terrible memories that are 21 years old now. Take a moment to remember, to honor the lives lost and the futures dimmed. Cook something comforting and serve it to those you care about.

title: What We Pray for When We Pray for Our Children
description: Annie Dillard once wrote that how we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives. And Ive long been drawn to the daily habits and disciplines that form us and, in the end, shape our whole lives. There is something so personal and intimate about revealing our routines, our patterns, those often quiet activities that ultimately form who we are. This is especially true when it comes to our families, and the prayers we say for our children.

title: Electric Cars: How to Win Over Consumers
description: To the Editor:

title: Marni Makes Magic Under the Manhattan Bridge
description: The dank streetscape under the cavernous arches of the Manhattan Bridge, where Brooklyn falls away into the East River and the B, D, N and Q trains rumble ominously overhead, is not, really, where most people imagine a glitzy fashion show to take place.

title: It Takes a Lot of Skill and a Little Luck to Be a World Chess Champion
description: Chess at the world championship level can often feel very static. Wilhelm Steinitz, Bobby Fischer and Magnus Carlsen all earned the crown because they were the best in the world. Luck may be a factor in any individual game, but its role in the context of a long match is greatly diminished.

title: Review: In Antony and Cleopatra, John Adams Goes Conventional
description: SAN FRANCISCO  John Adamss operas have never been ordinary.

title: With Queen Gone, Former Colonies Find a Moment to Rethink Lasting Ties
description: HONIARA, Solomon Islands  Millicent Barty has spent years trying to decolonize her country, recording oral histories across the Solomon Islands and promoting Melanesian culture. Her goal: to prioritize local knowledge, not just what arrived with the British Empire.

title: Marking 9/11, Biden Remembers the Precious Lives Stolen From Us
description: WASHINGTON  Twenty-one years after the Sept. 11 attacks, President Biden promised to never forget the precious lives stolen from us as he honored victims of the worst terrorist strike in American history with a somber wreath-laying ceremony under the pouring rain at the Pentagon.

title: In The Fabelmans, Steven Spielberg Himself Is the Star
description: Steven Spielbergs The Fabelmans is the movie every fall film festival was dying to have, but only Toronto got it. And at the Saturday-night premiere, the collective excitement was making people lose their minds.

title: My Chemical Romance, Reunited and It Feels So Bruised
description: In 2006, My Chemical Romance  by then, an edgy screamo band turned ostentatious pop-punk dramatists  released The Black Parade, a flashy and theatrical opus that established the group as art-house emo sophisticates. It maintained some of the scabrousness of its earlier albums, and smeared big-tent pop ambition atop it: The Wall for the TRL era.

title: The Week in Business: A Trump Deal in Limbo
description: The social media venture of former President Donald J. Trump, who has long trumpeted his deal-making skills, has an uncertain future after a twist in its planned merger with Digital World Acquisition Corporation, a special purpose acquisition company, or SPAC. Trump Media & Technology Group was supposed to have merged with the company by Thursday. But federal investigations and scrutiny from securities regulators have bogged down the merger, and when Thursday came, Digital World scrambled to get the shareholder votes for a one-year extension of the deadline. When it failed to get the necessary support for the extension, the company unexpectedly adjourned and postponed the vote, then said it would pay nearly $3 million to buy itself three more months to carry out the merger, leaving Trump Media in limbo. On Friday, Trump Media blamed the Securities and Exchange Commission for its troubles, saying the agency needlessly delayed its review of the proposed merger.

title: Review: In John Jasperses Visitation, Mortality Seduces
description: A body under a sheet: Thats how children play at summoning ghosts. Its also how John Jasperses latest dance, Visitation, begins.

title: Wildfire in Washington Blows Toxic Air to Seattle and Surrounding Areas
description: A rare westerly wind and rain showers offered a respite to fire response teams as they fought to keep a wildfire from reaching populated areas near Washington States Cascade Mountains on Sunday, a fire official said.

title: Mourners will be able to view the queens coffin in Scotland and London.
description: When the queen mother died in 2002, aged 101, about 200,000 people paid their respects in a line of mourners that extended for more than a mile from the Palace of Westminster, over Lambeth Bridge, and packed the sidewalks along the south bank of the River Thames.

title: Why Did Instagram Pause This Play? Its Creators Still Dont Know.
description: PARIS  It was hailed as Frances first Instagram play. In Marion Siferts _jeanne_dark_, a 16-year-old character, Jeanne, goes live on the app to tell the world about her private frustrations  and as she films herself with a smartphone onstage, Instagram users can watch, too, and weigh in.

title: Democrats Black Male Voter Problem
description: Last month in a videotaped appearance for a Pod Save America live show, Stacey Abrams, a celebrated Democratic activist and the Democratic nominee for governor of Georgia, said that Black men have the power to determine the election in that state.

title: Expanded Safety Net Drives Sharp Drop in Child Poverty
description: WASHINGTON  For a generation or more, Americas high levels of child poverty set it apart from other rich nations, leaving millions of young people lacking support as basic as food and shelter amid mounting evidence that early hardship leaves children poorer, sicker and less educated as adults.

title: After Sept. 11, Queen Elizabeth Ordered Up The Star-Spangled Banner
description: With its protocols and pageantry, the British monarchys adherence to tradition is so strong that a departure from its norms speaks volumes.

title: Gwendolyn Midlo Hall, 93, Dies; Created Database of Enslaved People
description: Gwendolyn Midlo Hall, who after years of digging through obscure libraries in Louisiana, Spain and France managed to rescue the identities of more than 100,000 enslaved people from archival oblivion and demonstrate the vast extent of African influence on Americas cultural heritage, died on Aug. 29 in Guanajuato, Mexico, about 200 miles northwest of Mexico City. She was 93.

title: Queens Ties to Scotland Add New Wrinkle to Push for Independence
description: EDINBURGH  Its streets lined with tens of thousands of admirers, Scotland bade a somber farewell to Queen Elizabeth II on Sunday as her coffin made its slow, final, journey through a country that she helped bind into the British state through her decades of rule, her love of the wild Scottish countryside and her own popularity.

title: Home at Last in the Wind, Rain and Isolation of the North Sea Coast
description: At one point there were geese. But before the geese came, I stood in the garden. Storm season, December 2014, afternoon, on the North Sea Coast in Denmark. A big beaten-up horse chestnut was to the right, and the wind had ripped the apples off the apple tree way back in October. The shrubbery down at the propertys end: ragged. And then came the drizzle, and soon it was raining, and I had the house keys in my hand.

title: Man Sentenced After 12 Years of Threats to an Actress and Her Daughter
description: A man in Ohio was sentenced to more than three years in prison after 12 years of harassing the actress Eva LaRue and her daughter. He had threatened via letters and phone calls to torture, kill and rape them, the authorities said.

title: Transfer Portal Sends U.S.C. Football Into a New Dimension
description: STANFORD, Calif.  Finding all the University of Southern California football players who transferred in over the winter was not terribly difficult on Saturday night. All you had to do was look in the end zone.

title: Queen Elizabeths Corgis Will Stay in the Family
description: For the legions of dog lovers who have wondered what will happen to Queen Elizabeths two surviving corgis, there is clarity: One of the queens sons will keep the dogs in the family.

title: At Corporate Pep Rally, Disney C.E.O. Pitches Warmer, Fuzzier Side
description: Every few years, the Walt Disney Company stages a colossal pep rally for its most ardent fans. The three-day event is called D23 Expo, and roughly 140,000 people pay anywhere from $79 to $899 for the chance to see Disney stars, preview upcoming movies and learn about new theme park rides.

title: Ukraine says Russia is retaliating by hitting critical infrastructure, causing blackouts.
description: Russian attacks on critical infrastructure knocked out power in Ukraines northeast, Ukrainian officials said on Sunday night, condemning the strikes as an apparent act of revenge for Kyivs swift gains in the region.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Ukraine Gains Ground
description: Ukraine has been moving forward in a lightning advance that appears to have reshaped the war and smashed what had been a monthslong stalemate.

title: Russias Retreat in Ukraine Pokes Holes in Putins Projection of Force
description: Ukraines rout of Russian forces this weekend is creating a new kind of political challenge for President Vladimir V. Putin: It undercuts the image of competence and might that he has worked for two decades to build.

title: N.Y. State Vote Could Raise Pressure on Officials Over Hasidic Schools
description: New York public officials faced questions on Sunday about their lack of oversight of private Hasidic Jewish schools after The New York Times revealed that the schools collect large sums of government money but deny many students a basic education.

title: Parenthetical Comment
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Congratulations to the constructor Michael Lieberman, who is making his eighth appearance in the daily New York Times Crossword (or his 12th appearance if you include his variety puzzles). Mr. Liebermans puzzle features a tight theme and a spot-on revealer (more on that below).

title: Ukraine Routs Russian Forces in Northeast, Forcing a Retreat
description: KHARKIV, Ukraine  Stunned by a lightning advance by Ukrainian forces that cost it over 1,000 square miles of land and a key military hub, Russia on Sunday acknowledged that it had lost nearly all of the northern region of Kharkiv after a blitzkrieg thrust that cast doubt on a premise  widely held in Moscow and parts of the West  that Ukraine could never defeat Russia.

title: War of the Worlds Review: Dystopia  la Franaise
description: This review contains spoilers for the first two seasons of War of the Worlds.

title: In Lieu of Revenge, Baker Mayfield Is Humbled Again by the Browns
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  The end to Sundays game was abrupt and unexpected, just like Baker Mayfield has described the end of his time as the Cleveland Browns quarterback.

title: Persistent Rains Pummel Chicago, Submerging Roads and Swamping Basements
description: CHICAGO  Torrential, unrelenting rains swept through Chicago on Sunday, flooding basements and alleys, closing grocery stores and restaurants, and leaving cars floating under viaducts on streets impassable with deep water.

title: A Brief Reprieve in Californias Raging Wildfire Fight
description: Improved weather conditions over the weekend allowed California firefighters to make progress on some of the states toughest blazes. But the battles are far from over, and the height of fire season could be approaching.

title: What We Learned From Week 1 of the N.F.L. Season
description: The first week of the N.F.L.s regular season never fails to make a mess. Upsets, mistakes, miracles and everything in between come pouring out as the season starts anew. Week 1s false starts may have been a wake-up call to teams and their fans that the games count again  and that even a shaky start can offer firm takeaways.

title: Carlos Alcaraz Wins U.S. Open Mens Singles Title, and Becomes No. 1
description: The future of tennis arrived at 7:38 p.m. Sunday with a rocketed serve off the racket of Carlos Alcaraz, who clinched the U.S. Open mens singles championship, announcing the start of a new era in the game.

title: Swedens Divisive Election Is Too Close to Call, Officials Say
description: HALMSTAD, Sweden  A tight political race in Sweden led the countrys election authority to delay the announcement of preliminary results as it continued counting votes, with a coalition of right-wing parties narrowly leading the governing center-left bloc early on Monday.

title: Aces Score Just Enough to Take W.N.B.A. Finals Lead
description: LAS VEGAS  The W.N.B.A. finals have many compelling story lines: two franchises, and two coaches, looking for their first title; a high-powered offense taking on a stingy defense.

title: Former M.L.B. Pitcher Turned Police Officer Killed in Car Crash
description: A former Major League Baseball pitcher who became a Port Authority police officer after retiring from the sport was killed in a car crash on Sunday while driving to a Sept. 11 commemoration in New York, according to the authorities and his former team.

title: On the Quiet Hardcourts in Spain, Carlos Alcarazs Star Was Already Shining
description: In December, when I visited Carlos Alcaraz and his coach, Juan Carlos Ferrero, at the academy where they are based in the stark countryside of Villena, Spain, both calmly and reasonably explained that the goal for 2022 was to break into the top 15.

title: House of the Dragon Season 1, Episode 4 Recap: The Full Targaryen
description: You Targaryens do have queer customs.

title: N.F.L. Week 1: Five Face-Palm-Worthy Endings
description: The N.F.L. is back, and so are the seesaw finishes with inexplicable penalties, missed field goals and other boneheaded moves.

title: The Radical Constitutional Change Britain Needs
description: Just over a century ago, Lytton Strachey, a literary lion of the Bloomsbury Group, tried to sum up the impact of Queen Victorias death. She had succeeded in her 63-year reign in becoming profoundly familiar, he wrote, occupying with satisfying ease a distinct and memorable place. Consequently, when Victoria died in 1901, Strachey went on, it seemed to many  and not just in the United Kingdom  a monstrous reversal of the course of nature, a breach in the whole scheme of things.

title: Whats on TV This Week: Atlanta and Fall Previews
description: Between network, cable and streaming, the modern television landscape is a vast one. Here are some of the shows, specials and movies coming to TV this week, Sept. 12-18. Details and times are subject to change.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Russia acknowledged that it had lost much of Kharkiv, a military stronghold, as Ukraines lightning advance took back over 1,000 square miles of land and a key military hub. Russia has now retreated from a wide section of Ukrainian territory that it had earlier seized, rattling Kremlin cheerleaders and amplifying calls for more weapons to be sent to Ukraine.

title: How the Brooklyn Library Helped Fight Book Bans in Oklahoma
description: Good morning. Its Monday. Well look at how a QR code from the Brooklyn Public Library figured in an Oklahoma teachers resignation. Well also look at how New York officials are facing questions about oversight in Hasidic schools as the state Board of Regents considers rules for holding private schools to minimum academic standards.

title: Word of the Day: moratorium
description: The word moratorium has appeared in 247 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Aug. 29 in Secret Data, Tiny Islands and a Quest for Treasure on the Ocean Floor by Eric Lipton:

title: Quotation of the Day: Queens Scottish Ties Muddle Push for Independence
description: I personally feel she chose to die here; she knew her time was coming. She had a love for Scotland, and people here have come out in droves.

title: No Corrections: Sept. 12, 2022
description: Errors are corrected during the press run whenever possible, so some errors noted here may not have appeared in all editions.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: MONDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: I Abandoned My Skinny Jeans. What Top Do I Wear With Baggy Pants?
description: When Levis declared the death of skinny jeans in the summer of 2021, there was both denial (skinny jeans forever!) and celebration (finally!). Whatever camp you fell into, however, its true that baggy, oversize pants are staging a comeback, in part because of the Covid-sparked focus on comfortwear, and in part because, as Laura Brown, the editor and creative consultant, said, theres something about the swish of that much fabric around the legs that can make you feel very stride-y.

title: In Atlanta, a Local Prosecutor Takes on Murder, Street Gangs and a President
description: ATLANTA  Fani T. Willis strode up to a podium in a red dress late last month in downtown Atlanta, flanked by an array of dark suits and stone-faced officers in uniform. Her voice rang out loud and clear, with a hint of swagger.

title: Finding Humor, and Humanity, in Canadas Oil Fields
description: In 2005, Kate Beaton was 21, with a brand-new degree in history and anthropology, student loans she said felt like a foot on her neck, and few job prospects. Around her home in Cape Breton, a picturesque, wooded island in Nova Scotia, the joke was that everyone was on pogie, she said  on unemployment.

title: Monkeypox Shots, Treatments and Tests Are Unavailable in Much of the World
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Explore How CRISPR Is Revolutionizing Science
description: Featured Article: CRISPR, 10 Years On: Learning to Rewrite the Code of Life by Carl Zimmer

title: Nick Cave Lost Two Sons. His Fans Then Saved His Life.
description: People say, How can you go on tour?, says the musician and co-author of a new book, For me its the other way around. How could I not?

title: $5 Million Homes in California
description: About half a mile from Manhattan Beach Pier, this house was designed with beachgoers in mind, with plenty of storage for surfboards and other gear, as well as an outdoor shower for washing off sand. Veterans Parkway, a trail that draws dog owners and cyclists, is a few blocks away, as is Live Oak Park, which has designated play and picnic areas.

title: How Punctual Are You?
description: Do you always show up on time to class, appointments, work or parties  or are you always just a little bit late? How do you feel about people who are more or less punctual than you are?

title: The Killing of Eliza Fletcher Is a Tragedy, Not a Morality Play
description: NASHVILLE  On Sept. 2, when Eliza Fletcher hadnt returned from her usual early morning run, her husband called the Memphis Police Department.

title: Mark Finchem Says Biden Didnt Win in 2020, and He Has Big Plans for Elections in Arizona
description: Mark Finchem, the Republican nominee for Arizonas secretary of state, talks a lot about tracking: procedures, processes, audits, the path a ballot takes from voter to tabulator.

title: David Milch Made Remarkable TV. His Own Life Was a Drama, Too.
description: One of the best things about the birth of television, Joyce Carol Oates implied in You Must Remember This, her 1987 novel, was that it brought laughter into certain homes where laughter did not previously exist.

title: Must We Discuss the Queen and the Donald in the Same Breath?
description: Gail Collins: Bret, I guess we should begin with the queen. Hey, thats a change of pace, right?

title: Introducing The Tilt, a Newsletter About Elections and Polling
description: Ahead of the 2020 election, I wrote a daily article on the latest polls  internally, we called it my polling diary. To my surprise, tens of thousands of people signed up to be notified whenever we published a new diary entry. You might be one of them!

title: How Hard Is It to Disappear in America?
description: Jonathan Dee, at 60 years of age and with eight books to his credit  one of which, The Privileges, was a finalist for the Pulitzer Prize in 2011  should by now be regarded as, if not officially a national treasure, then at the very least a natural resource: a rare bird, perhaps, or a dependable supply of fresh water. Especially to his credit is the fact that he has resisted the considerable temptation, widespread among comfortably established writers, to endlessly refine (read: repeat) a successful formula, which often seems to be what readers want and publishers, however tacitly, demand. Dee is a risk taker, in other words, and his restless, adventurous, at times reckless approach is nowhere more evident than in his latest roll of the dice: the taut, bare-bones, not entirely user-friendly Sugar Street.

title: Yes, the Polling Warning Signs Are Flashing Again
description: Ahead of the last presidential election, we created a website tracking the latest polls  internally, we called it a polling diary. Despite a tough polling cycle, one feature proved to be particularly helpful: a table showing what would happen if the 2020 polls were as wrong as they were in 2016, when pollsters systematically underestimated Donald J. Trumps strength against Hillary Clinton.

title: A Music Producer Finds a Waterfront Home, and a More Harmonious Commute
description: Since moving to Weehawken, N.J., last fall, Stanley Brown has developed a nightly habit: He works long hours at the recording studio he runs in Midtown Manhattan, and usually takes an Uber home at 2 or 3 in the morning. When he arrives at his apartment building, which sits along the Hudson River with an unfettered view of Manhattan, he takes a quiet walk along the riverfront to process his day.

title: Big Mouths About Big Debt
description: For over a decade, Nika Booth had a secret. I didnt tell anyone, and it was eating me up, she said. I was even in serious relationships where I never said anything about it. To make matters worse, her secret was getting bigger. I felt like I was going crazy, she said. But I grew up in a home where you dont talk about your personal struggles, so I kept it to myself.

title: Store Shelves Are No Longer Bare, but Baby Formula Remains in Short Supply
description: More than six months after one of the largest infant formula manufacturing plants in the United States issued a recall and was then shut down because of contamination concerns, a newborn staple remains in short supply.

title: Cracking the Case of the Giant Fern Genome
description: Humans, like many complex organisms, have large genomes, which contain the codes for our lives. Want to explain your dark hair, thin bones and existential dread? Look to your 46 chromosomes and three billion nucleotide base pairs.

title: Anti-Monarchists Tread Lightly After Queens Death, but Their Goal Persists
description: LONDON  When Queen Elizabeth II died on Thursday, the most prominent anti-monarchist movement in Britain did what it had been planning to do for years upon her death: It lay low.

title: A Journey Through Black Nova Scotia
description: Whenever I travel and tell people where Im from, they always say, There are Black people in Nova Scotia? said Ren Boudreau, 30, founder of Elevate and Explore Black Nova Scotia, a travel community and experiential business designed to inspire Black travelers to visit the province. Theyre always surprised when Im like, Weve been here for 400 years.

title: How to Avoid Hurting Yourself at the Gym
description: Torn ligaments. Pulled muscles. Overuse injuries. With every new exercise routine comes a new risk of injury, whether its straining a muscle from lifting, developing knee pain from running, or tearing a tendon during calisthenics. With an estimated 8.6 million sports and recreation-related injuries each year in America, these fears are not unfounded.

title: The Wives of Republican Candidates Are Getting Personal
description: Ready or not, here come the political wives.

title: How Family and Friends Helped Get Me Through the Pandemic
description: This article is part of the I Want to Thank You series. We asked readers to tell us about who helped get them through the pandemic; these are a selection of their stories about their families and friends. Future articles will focus on health care workers and inspirational figures.

title: A Plan to Push Cars Out of Manhattan Could Make the Bronxs Air Dirtier
description: The plan to put tolls on drivers on Manhattans busiest streets is intended to spare New York Citys central business district from pollution and gridlock while raising money for public transit.

title: Trial Begins for Truck Maker Accused of Duping Investors
description: The founder of Nikola Motor, a maker of electric trucks, went on trial on fraud charges on Monday in a case seen as a cautionary tale about the hazards of investing in companies that are not yet generating any sales or delivering any products.

title: Prince Harry Pays Tribute to Granny
description: Follow the latest news on Queen Elizabeth IIs funeral.

title: Serena Williamss Final Run
description: The U.S. Open crowned its winners this weekend. But for a lot of fans, this years competition was less about who won, and more about a player who wasnt even involved in the final matches.

title: Are the Polls Wrong Again?
description: The final polls in the 2020 presidential election overstated Joe Bidens strength, especially in a handful of states.

title: For the Yankees, a Thin Roster but a Crowded Infield
description: During a rain delay on Sunday, a video of Anthony Volpe played on Yankee Stadiums Jumbotron for the few hundred fans waiting for the game to start.

title: Rachel Sennott Just Wants You to Have the Time of Your Life
